column3: Lead Project Coordinator at A University
column17:
I believe that a good scrapper would be ideal. I use lots of excels for data comparispn reasons (i.e. Schools that offer x degree, and/or are located in y country). 

Current LLMs give you some of that but you need to triple check each result, which isnt ideal.

One that assists with inventory in warehousing using spacial assistance instead of manual input. Using it for work environments and data collation is more useful to people than art theft and writing theft.

Personally, I use it to debate and explore new philosophical and political ideas. I believe that before continuing to create more AI tools, we should educate ourselves to rethink the methodology (why the hell AI is being forbiden in schoosl!? It's such a nice tool!!!). Technology moves faster than our education, our laws, and our ability to change society.

I use AI as glorified documentation while programming and as a helper while learning russian or studying mathematics or chemistry.

It's useful as a first step before browsing the web for deeper information. Or as a way to compare code with other sources.

Further development in these areas would be nice.
happy with what AI does now
